content: your hook in the lts and pull up a loop now you ll be working a special retp across these stitches yo pull through the lts then *yo pull through 1 yo pull through 2* repeat from * to * until you have three loops on your hook yo pull through 1 yo pull through 1 this will combine the two tfs sts together to count them as one st 25 row 3 *work one tps then place one tfs before the v shaped st the two combined tfs sts from the previous row and then place one tfs after the v shaped st * repeat from * to * until the lts where you ll have just worked a tps before the lts then work the lts then work the special retp row across these will be the same instructions worked from row 3 shown between 25 row 4 - 154 repeat row 3 154 row create a scarf that s 64 if you d like a different length you can continue the row repeat until the desired length or stop early row 155 you re going to now work across the row of the scarf to close off your tunisian crochet sts *work a tps as normal but after pull that loop through the 2nd loop on your hook ending with one loop on your hook then work 2 tfs sts as normal around the v st but then yo pull through all loops on your hook * repeat from * to * until the lts insert your hook into the lts pull up a loop and pull it through the 2nd loop on your hook f/o leaving around a 5 /13 cm long tail 4 everglade scarf mae crochets tassles because you left around 5 /13 cm long tails on both sides of the scarf you ll just incorporate these into the tassels so no need to weave in the ends you can watch a helpful video here cut 50 yarn strands each around 11 /28 cm long next fold a strand in half insert your hook into one of the sts at the bottom or top of the scarf and pull the looped side of the strand through the work partly then use your hook to pull the rest of the strand through that loop and tighten trim the edges to be even you re done i hope that you enjoyed this pattern share your finished work by tagging #evergladescarf and @mae crochets if you are interested in seeing more of my patterns you can find them at www maecrochets com 5
